synthesized_claims.statement: Physiological Ca²⁺ oscillations (0.1–10 Hz) can rhythmically modulate VDAC1 gating, creating pulsatile metabolite flux.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Cytosolic Ca²⁺ binds to VDAC1, altering its voltage-dependent gating kinetics on a timescale matching oscillation periods.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Direct patch-clamp of VDAC1 in intact mitochondria showing no change in open probability when challenged with physiological-frequency Ca²⁺ pulses.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Physiological Ca²⁺ oscillations (0.1–10 Hz) can rhythmically modulate VDAC1 gating, creating pulsatile metabolite flux.

synthesized_claims.statement: VDAC1 oligomerization is driven by cumulative matrix Ca²⁺ overload rather than directly by oscillation frequency — but frequency encodes the *rate* of matrix accumulation, so a frequency threshold (~1–2 Hz sustained) effectively exists above which oligomerization probability sharply increases.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: High-frequency Ca²⁺ pulses exceed mitochondrial Ca²⁺ efflux capacity (NCLX), causing progressive matrix Ca²⁺ accumulation → mPTP sensitization → VDAC1 oligomerization via conformational changes/cytochrome c release.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Demonstrating that total Ca²⁺ load, not frequency, determines oligomerization when integral is matched across different frequency protocols.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: VDAC1 oligomerization is driven by cumulative matrix Ca²⁺ overload rather than directly by oscillation frequency — but frequency encodes the *rate* of matrix accumulation, so a frequency threshold (~1–2 Hz sustained) effectively exists above which oligomerization probability sharply increases.

synthesized_claims.statement: VDAC1/MCU form a two-gate filter: VDAC1 permits cytosolic Ca²⁺ bursts to IMS (rate-limited by voltage/Ca²⁺ gating); MCU rectifies high-freq bursts for matrix uptake (K_d ~1-20 μM, Hill n>1).
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Spatial proximity (~10 nm) and MICU1/2 sensing ensure MCU activates only at peak [Ca²⁺]_IMS >5 μM from VDAC1.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Super-res EM or FRAP showing no VDAC1-MCU co-localization/flux coupling.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: VDAC1/MCU form a two-gate filter: VDAC1 permits cytosolic Ca²⁺ bursts to IMS (rate-limited by voltage/Ca²⁺ gating); MCU rectifies high-freq bursts for matrix uptake (K_d ~1-20 μM, Hill n>1).

synthesized_claims.statement: Cancer cells remodel Ca²⁺ oscillation machinery (IP3R, SERCA, STIM/Orai) to reduce oscillation amplitude and increase frequency irregularity, maintaining VDAC1 in monomeric state — this represents a distinct gate-jamming mechanism complementary to HK-II binding.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Comprehensive Ca²⁺ imaging in matched cancer/normal cells showing no systematic difference in mitochondrial Ca²⁺ oscillation parameters. ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Cancer cells remodel Ca²⁺ oscillation machinery (IP3R, SERCA, STIM/Orai) to reduce oscillation amplitude and increase frequency irregularity, maintaining VDAC1 in monomeric state — this represents a distinct gate-jamming mechanism complementary to HK-II binding.

synthesized_claims.statement: Pacing mitochondrial Ca²⁺ uptake (e.g., via optogenetics or pharmacological modulators) can shift VDAC1 toward oligomerization and apoptosis in cancer, with a therapeutic index >10.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Forced high-frequency Ca²⁺ transients (e.g., 5 Hz) may override cancer’s endogenous low-frequency signals, inducing VDAC1 oligomerization and cytochrome c release.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: In vivo models showing no apoptosis induction at therapeutic doses, or off-target toxicity (e.g., cardiac arrhythmias) at <10x effective dose. --- ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Pacing mitochondrial Ca²⁺ uptake (e.g., via optogenetics or pharmacological modulators) can shift VDAC1 toward oligomerization and apoptosis in cancer, with a therapeutic index >10.

synthesized_claims.statement: The coordination of low-affinity VDAC1 and high-affinity MCU creates a band-pass filter, allowing mitochondria to respond to large, rapid Ca2+ spikes while ignoring small, slow fluctuations.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: VDAC1 passes high-amplitude Ca2+ signals into the intermembrane space, creating a localized pool that is then efficiently taken up by the high-affinity MCU, effectively filtering for salient signals.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Direct measurement of intermembrane space Ca2+ showing its concentration profile is a simple, non-filtered reflection of cytosolic Ca2+ dynamics. ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: The coordination of low-affinity VDAC1 and high-affinity MCU creates a band-pass filter, allowing mitochondria to respond to large, rapid Ca2+ spikes while ignoring small, slow fluctuations.

synthesized_claims.statement: Pacing mito Ca²⁺ uptake freq. (>2 Hz) is viable therapeutic target to oligomerize VDAC1 in cancer (safety index >10 if selective), superior to CBD (Kd=11 μM, window 1-10 μM but CYP3A4 IC50=1 μM).
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Opto/genetic MCU pacing (e.g., opto-MCU) forces high-freq uptake, bypassing cancer-damped signals.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Freq.-paced MCF7 cells (dox IC50=0.5 μM benchmark) showing no apoptosis shift vs. vehicle. ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Pacing mito Ca²⁺ uptake freq. (>2 Hz) is viable therapeutic target to oligomerize VDAC1 in cancer (safety index >10 if selective), superior to CBD (Kd=11 μM, window 1-10 μM but CYP3A4 IC50=1 μM).
